children.subject: You can send us the form via email and then we will send it back to you signed after we talk and review the form.
Which email address should I send it to? Do I need to make an appointment through phone first and then send the email or can I directly send the email?

If you make an appointment, send it to the person you made the appointment with or to cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu.  You can also email us with questions and your forms at cs-advising without an appointment. If it's simple enough without an appointment, we're happy to sign and send back to you via email.
If I need to sign for forms (for example double major form), how can I do that if all appointment are via phone.

I would suggest writing to cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu  or directly to the person who the appointment was with (I don't think it was me...) to see what

format you should use.
We'll try to reach out ahead of time, but it would be helpful if you email us, like the student above suggested. Thanks!
If I made a physical appointment already, do I need to make any changes to this, or will I be contacted about which form of communication I prefer?
Haha. Chill and wait for an official announcement.
The faculty are still determining how this will affect declaring for CS and other areas that impact our students. We will send an update as soon as we have a decision from them.
Hi! Now that classes are all p/np, how is that accounted for in terms of gpa to declare CS? Would we have to request a letter grade for the classes we need to declare?
Hello. I m a current transfer student at Cal (Spring admit 2020). I would like to know what classes I can take for EECS just for fun...

history.content:
Dear CS Community,

We hope this email finds you well during this time of academic course changes and the COVID-19 updates. Remember to take a deep breath and take care of yourselves!

We are reaching out to let you know that effective Thursday, March 12, all CS advising appointments will be available only via phone, Google Hangouts, or Zoom. For now, all advising will be done on an appointment basis; we will not have drop in, however quick questions can be emailed to cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu. We hope to resume in-person appointments and drop-in advising once we have more info from campus and will keep you posted.

Both Google Hangouts and Zoom have screen sharing abilities, if you need to share documents with us for your appointment. You can also send us forms or documents via email.

Let us know if you have any questions. Stay safe and healthy!

CS Advisors
history.subject: Computer Science Advising UPDATE

history.content:
Dear CS Community,

We hope this email finds you well during this time of academic course changes and the COVID-19 updates. Remember to take a deep breath and take care of yourselves!

We are reaching out to let you know that effective Thursday, March 12, all CS advising appointments will be available only via phone, Google Hangouts, or Zoom. For now, all advising will be done on an appointment basis; we will not have drop in, however quick questions can be emailed to cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu. We hope to resume in-person appointments and drop-in advising once we have more info from campus and will keep you posted.

Both Google Hangouts and Zoom have screen sharing abilities, if you need to share documents with us for your appointment. You can also send us forms or documents via email.

Let us know if you have any questions. Stay safe and healthy!

CS Advisors

#pin
history.subject: Computer Science Advising UPDATE

history.content:
Dear CS Community,

We hope this email finds you well during this time of academic course changes and the COVID-19 updates. Remember to take a deep breath and take care of yourselves!

We are reaching out to let you know that effective Thursday, March 12 through Spring Break (March 29), all CS advising appointments will be available only via phone, Google Hangouts, or Zoom. Drop-in advising will be unavailable on 3/18 and 3/25. We hope to resume in-person appointments and drop-in advising once we have more info from campus and will keep you posted. We are also available by email, cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu.

Both Google Hangouts and Zoom have screen sharing abilities, if you need to share documents with us for your appointment. You can also send us forms or documents via email.

Note that CalCentral will only have phone or Google Hangouts as options for appointment. If you wish to use Zoom, choose either option and include a note that you prefer to use Zoom. We will send you a Zoom invitation at the beginning of our appointment time.

Let us know if you have any questions. Stay safe and healthy!

CS Advisors

#pin
